options.content:
SPHINX - Data Traffic Monitoring

Dashboard manual Component manual
DTM Webpage

Short description

DTM is a signature based detection system, and it is able to capture, analyze, various traffic in a network, with the help of agents and is responsible with the transmission of alerts. DTM monitors network traffic by applying signature-based detection analysis, sends traffic information, including information about connected devices or if a device has been idle for a long time, sends abnormal and suspicious traffic activity

Objectives

  • * Scan traffic
  • * Raise alerts

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
a.id AS "ID",
b.id AS "ID FROM ALERT PANEL",
a.signature AS "SIGNATURE",
a.timestamp AS "TIMESTAMP",
a.protocol AS "PROTOCOL",
a.host AS "HOST",
a.src_ip AS "SOURCE IP",
a.src_port AS "SOURCE PORT",
a.dest_ip AS "DESTINATION IP",
a.dest_port AS "DESTINATION PORT",
a.event_type AS "EVENT TYPE",
a.severity AS "SEVERITY",
a.category AS "CATEGORY",
a.action AS "ACTION",
a.signature_severity AS "SIGNATURE SEVERITY",
a.location AS LOCATION,
a.source_ref AS "SOURCE REF",
a.relationship_type AS "RELATIONSHIP TYPE",
a.target_ref AS "TARGET REF",
a.details AS "DETAILS",
a.alert_type_id AS "ALERT TYPE ID",
a.created_date AS "CREATED DATE",
a.updated_date AS "UPDATED DATE",
a.count AS "COUNT",
a.jpa_version AS "JPA VERSION"
FROM alert a
INNER JOIN "kafka_ID_ALERTS" b
ON a.target_ref = b."ALERTID"
WHERE (a.timestamp::timestamp BETWEEN to_timestamp(${__from:date:seconds}) AND to_timestamp(${__to:date:seconds}))
ORDER BY a.id DESC limit 500;
